str2: Faith, belief, trust, confidence; fidelity, faithfulness.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Father, (Heavenly) Father, ancestor, elder, senior. Apparently a primary word; a 'father'.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To hide, conceal, lay up. A primary verb; to conceal.
Lasting three months. Neuter of a compound of treis and men as noun; a three months' space.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Passive - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From a variation of genos; to procreate; figuratively, to regenerate.
On this account, because, for. From dia and hoti; on the very account that, or inasmuch as.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: Properly, to stare at, i.e. to discern clearly; by extension, to attend to; by Hebraism, to experience; passively, to appear.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
(lit: belonging to the city; then: witty, clever), elegant, pretty, fair, fine, beautiful. From astu; urbane, i.e. handsome.
Neuter diminutive of pais; a childling, i.e., an infant, or a half-grown boy or girl; figuratively, an immature Christian.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From phobos; to frighten, i.e. to be alarmed; by analogy, to be in awe of, i.e. Revere.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A king, ruler, but in some passages clearly to be translated: emperor. Probably from basis; a sovereign.
A mandate, decree, edict. From diatasso; an arrangement, i.e. edict.
